Why "Cloud Resume Challenge"?

Here I will discuss what got me interested in the Cloud Resume Challenge. I recently passed my AZ-104 Azure Administrator Associate certification and I was itching to apply what I had learned to real cloud challenges. The Cloud Resume Challenge prioritizes self-study and figuring things out on your own. This is a skill set I have found to be invaluable and one that was used greatly throughout this project. Learn fast, and google well.

The ultimate goal of this challenge is a resume, written in html, hosted purely through Azure resources with a connection to an Azure Function API written in Python all managed using CI/CD via Github Actions.

Technologies Used

Here are the main technologies I used for the project:

Azure

Serverless function execution and web hosting/storage.

Python

Azure Function logic.

HTML/CSS/JS

Front-end development and basic scripting.

Github (actions)

Storing code and CI/CD workflows with Github Actions.

Visual Studio Code

Local coding and testing.

Project Overview

  • Phase 1: Front-End (HTML/CSS)

    • With a college degree in Graphic Design, I have a great foundation for this section. Building a css style sheet from the ground up is not something I had done before and it proved to be a very engaging task. I went with a duo-tone style that keeps the text airy and the website open.

  • Phase 2: Website Hosting

  • Phase 3: Azure Function

    • My custom Azure Function written in Python. Pretty simple code that calls the Google Page Speed Insights API and parses the response to get the page speed score for https://www.golearncloud.com. The biggest hurdle in this section was parsing JSON and API management in general. I had no experience building my own API so the python library Requests documentation was a big help to me for this phase.

  • Phase 4: Enabling CI/CD workflows on Github

    • This was new territory for me. I had forked Github projects in the past but never setup Github actions. Luckily I found a great Microsoft Learn Article that introduced me to Github secrets and the almighty workflow.yml.

Results


Thank you for reading! If you would like to know more about me and this project, email me at aepstein@golearncloud.com.

Professional Summary

IT Professional with 2 years of experience managing IT infrastructure, including Active Directory, Azure, VMware, and Entra ID. Demonstrated proficiency in enhancing system efficiency and streamlining IT asset management, supporting over 170 end-users and maintaining optimal performance for virtual machines and servers. Skilled in implementing automation and compliance measures, ensuring seamless operations and minimal downtime.

Employment History

Axley Attorneys- Help Desk Technician November 2022- August 2024

  • Provide technical support for 170 end-users, resolving over 60 tickets weekly, enhancing organization efficiency.
  • Handle licensing and manage user resources through 365 Admin and Exchange Admin, ensuring compliance.
  • Streamline IT asset management, tracking over 250 devices, ensuring timely upgrades and minimizing downtime
  • Oversee 28 Windows 11 virtual machines and 3 VMware ESXi hosts, maintaining optimal performance
  • Implement troubleshooting procedures on-site and remotely through RMM Tools (NinjaRMM and Atera)
  • Oversee new-user onboarding through Entra ID and managing MFA compliance via DUO admin/Microsoft Authenticator.
  • Develop custom Group Policy Objects to automate routine tasks, reducing manual workload and increasing productivity.
